data.title: 14 Our world will evolve to a phygital stage soon! Nicolas Prevost - yeamob by @Stephan Grad
data.meta_description:
15 years ago, it was exceptional if you were online while travelling through
Europe. Companies like Second Life were telling us stories of how our lives
would be lived rather online than offline, and many people were spooked by that
idea.
Forward to 2022, and we are at the gates of what will be known as the phygital
decade. The technology is here, and people are open to experiencing an
omnichannel lifestyle. More and more, our physical world and the digital world
merge into one.
What does that mean for each of us, what possibilities does the state of the art
technology provide and what will be the impacts on our personal lives? These are
the topics I am talking to Nicolas Prevost about in this episode of the Meet the
CEO Podcast.
Please enjoy this episode of the Meet the CEO Podcast - we now will be live
again regularly!
Nicolas Prevost on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicolas-pr%C3%A9vost-533575112/
Yeamob Website https://www.yeamob.com/

Episode Recommendation:

Do you already know Episode #9 with Stevanija Zecevic from BRADAS? This is the
most emotional episode of the Meet the CEO podcast so far because the story
behind the brand "BRADAS" is very heartwarming, tragic, and motivating at the
same time.
Stevanija and her husband Mirko tell it the best way, and it shows that often
you don't need a business plan to start a community, rather a very personal
mission. And being colourblind can be the way for a comfortable co-living in the
upcoming years.
You can find the episode on
Spotify https://open.spotify.com/episode/7lW8moPeClI9MCK3S9nUma
Apple
Podcast https://podcasts.apple.com/at/podcast/9-colorblindness-is-a-thing-we-could-really-use-for/id1576297623?i=1000537432335
data.text:
15 years ago, it was exceptional if you were online while travelling through Europe. Companies like Second Life were telling us stories of how our lives would be lived rather online than offline, and many people were spooked by that idea.

Forward to 2022, and we are at the gates of what will be known as the phygital decade. The technology is here, and people are open to experiencing an omnichannel lifestyle. More and more, our physical world and the digital world merge into one.

What does that mean for each of us, what possibilities does the state of the art technology provide and what will be the impacts on our personal lives? These are the topics I am talking to Nicolas Prevost about in this episode of the Meet the CEO Podcast.

Please enjoy this episode of the Meet the CEO Podcast - we now will be live again regularly!

Nicolas Prevost on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicolas-pr%C3%A9vost-533575112/

Yeamob Website https://www.yeamob.com/

Episode Recommendation:

Do you already know Episode #9 with Stevanija Zecevic from BRADAS? This is the most emotional episode of the Meet the CEO podcast so far because the story behind the brand "BRADAS" is very heartwarming, tragic, and motivating at the same time.

Stevanija and her husband Mirko tell it the best way, and it shows that often you don't need a business plan to start a community, rather a very personal mission. And being colourblind can be the way for a comfortable co-living in the upcoming years.

You can find the episode on

Spotify https://open.spotify.com/episode/7lW8moPeClI9MCK3S9nUma
